entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY THORUGH 12:00 P.M. FRIDAY FOR MUCH OF SOUTHERN OREGEON
entry.summary: January 7, 2025 4:00 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory is in effect through 12:00 p.m. Friday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said strong valley inversions will result in weak winds, poor mixing and ventilation. This will lead to stagnant air conditions that will trap pollutants near the surface....

entry.title: DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE HAS TIPS TO EASE TAX-FILING STRESS
entry.summary: January 7, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Revenue has tips to ease tax-filing stress now that the new year is here. entry.title: Tragic Discovery of Deceased Missing Person in Coos County
entry.summary: On January 5, 2025, a deceased person, identified as Joseph C. Neill, was discovered in Haynes Inlet after being missing since December 15, 2024.

entry.title: Tommy Whiteside debuts jazz album "Nana's Piano" at Rosebud Theatre
entry.summary: For drummer and composer Tommy Whiteside, debuting his new original album “Nana’s Piano” at the Rosebud Theatre wasn’t just an opportunity to show off his personal skills as a musician, but the talent of Roseburg’s music scene as a whole.

entry.title: UCC COMPLETES FIRST PHASE OF STUDENT HOUSING RENOVATIONS
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:20 a.m. Umpqua Community College has completed the first phase of student housing renovations on Southeast Jackson Street in downtown Roseburg. entry.title: Train trestle collapses in Corvallis, sending urea-laden railcars into the Mary's River
entry.summary: Corvallis Police and Fire crews responded to a train trestle collapse near Avery Park on Saturday afternoon. “Preliminary investigations indicate the trestle gave way while a freight train was passing over it. entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. SATURDAY FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: January 4, 2024 6:00 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory continues through 10:00 a.m. Saturday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon.
